June 13, 1921
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
Your letter of June 9 was received Saturday
morning in ample time for Doctor White to see it before
he sailed for Nicaragua. He was glad to have your judg-
ment in all the matters you discussed and took a copy of
your letter with him.

I had copies of Doctor Hanson's letters made for
Doctor White. It occurred to me that you might like to see
the full reports. I had not sent them to you previously
because we did not wish to trouble you unnecessarily, but in
view of your interest in the situation in Peru you may like
to keep in close touch with the progress of the work.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Florence M. Read
Assistant Secretary Doctor Henry R Carter
2121 California Street, N.W.
Washington, D.C.
